X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=211599040; y=IiVcLxS3hKl5P20r5Q5c4C_3fn_Ce3KEdlSvTRJG4Eqg9k60-bky

Hello all-

An article about digital evolution work at Michigan State University (Avida
and HyperNEAT) is currently the top story on NewScientist.com, in case you
are interested.  

Here is the main story: http://tinyurl.com/DigitalEvoMSU

Here is an editorial introducing the story and advocating the "bottom up"
approach to evolving AI. It also mentions my work on altruism (kin
selection) in Avida.

http://tinyurl.com/DigitalEvoMSUeditorial

If you are reading this in the future, and those links have broken, you can
use these links (note: it's not advisable to read while jetpacking):

Main article: 
https://www.msu.edu/~jclune/webfiles/press/NewScientist-ArtificialLifeFormsE
volveBasicIntelligence-Life-2010-08-04.pdf

Editorial:
https://www.msu.edu/~jclune/webfiles/press/NewScientist-DigitalEvolutionAndT
he MeaningOfLife-2010-08-04-Editorial.pdf

The article contains a direct link to the HyperNEAT user's page, which is
nice publicity for HyperNEAT. I encouraged the journalist to get in touch
with Ken and the UCF crew, and gave a quick summary of many of the great
results that have come out of UCF, so hopefully there will be a follow-up
article that describes even more about HyperNEAT.


Best regards,
Jeff Clune

Digital Evolution Lab, Michigan State University
jclune@...
www.msu.edu/~jclune
